FIHR 0.1.0
  • Reference

Searches for the best step size and computes the projection direction in high dimensional linear regression

Direction_searchtuning.Rd

Searches for the best step size and computes the projection direction in high dimensional linear regression

Direction_searchtuning(X, loading, mu = NULL, resol = 1.5, maxiter = 10)

Arguments

X

Design matrix, of dimension \(n\) x \(p\)
loading

Loading, of length \(p\)
mu

Tuning parameter in construction of projection direction
resol

Resolution or the factor by which mu is increased/decreased to obtain the smallest mu that gives convergence of the optimization problem for constructing the projection direction (default = 1.5)
maxiter

Maximum number of steps along which mu is increased/decreased to obtain the smallest mu that gives convergence of the optimization problem for constructing the projection direction (default = 10)

Value

proj

The projection direction

Examples

n = 100
p = 400
X = matrix(sample(-2:2,n*p,replace = TRUE),nrow = n,ncol = p)
Direction_searchtuning(X,loading=c(1,rep(0,(p-1))))
#> [1] 3
